pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Thursday, December 3, 2020 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

Private meetings.

10:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will deliver a speech in the House of Commons on the upcoming anniversary of the 1989 École Polytechnique de Montréal tragedy.

12:50 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a virtual conversation with faith leaders on the contribution of faith communities during the COVID-19 pandemic. Minister of Labour Filomena Tassi and Minister of Diversity and Inclusion and Youth Bardish Chagger will also participate in the event.

Closed to media.

1:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the United Nations’ Special Session of the General Assembly in Response to the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) Pandemic.

The session will be streamed via the following link: http://webtv.un.org

2:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will virtually visit Le Cartel, a small clothing business located in Montreal, joined by Member of Parliament for Outremont Rachel Bendayan. They will speak with the business’s two co-founders about economic supports they have accessed, helping their business recover during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Closed to media.
